member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor
member.summary: This is the interface for the interceptor The meaning of this interface is to make clear what the interceptor has: Extensions can register get/set/invokes It is called by a generated (or manually implemented) implementation of an interface, this implementation calls the Get/Set/Invoke Properties of the "interface" have a backingstore implemented via the special property "Properties" and some other helping properties.

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor.InitializationErrors
member.summary: Errors which occur during initialization are stored here

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor.InterceptedType
member.summary: The type which is intercepted

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor.Properties
member.summary: All the properties with their value

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor.PropertyTypes
member.summary: This is needed as a reflection cache

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor.PropertyNameFor(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve the real Property name, if you only have a key wh√≠ch isn't exact
member.param: Possible property name, like without capitals etc

member.summary: Add extension to the interceptor

member.summary: Return the value from the DescriptionAttribute of this property

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Get method, this will go through the extensions in the specified order and give the result

member.summary: Initialize the interceptor

member.summary: This will register a getter, with an order
member.param: The order is used to sort all getters, you can use the CallOrder enum for positioning
An Action for the getter, the argument is GetInfo

member.summary: This will register an action for a certain method. No overloading...

member.summary: Extensions for the IExtensibleInterceptor need to extend this interface.

member.summary: Specify the Init-Order, low first and high later

member.summary: After property initialization, in here exceptions can be ignored or caches created

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IInterceptorExtension.Initialize(Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor)
member.summary: Initialize the extension, this should register the methods/get/set

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IInterceptorExtension.InitProperty(Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.IExtensibleInterceptor,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: This is called for every Property on type T, so we only have 1x reflection

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.CallOrder
member.summary: Helper enum for the call order, used when registering the setter

member.name: F:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.CallOrder.First
member.summary: Everything which has this as their order would be invoked first

member.name: F:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.CallOrder.Middle
member.summary: Everything which has this as their order would be invoked somewhere between first and last

member.name: F:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.CallOrder.Last
member.summary: Everything which has this as their order would be invoked last

member.summary: Implementation of the IInterceptor

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Add an extension to the proxy, these extensions contain logic which enhances the proxy

member.summary: Get the description attribute for a property

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.Init
member.summary: Initialize, make sure every property is processed by the extensions

member.summary: Called after the Initialization, this allows us to e.g. ignore errors

member.summary: Call all extensions to initialize whatever needs to be initialized for a property

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.System#ICloneable#Clone
member.summary: Make a shallow copy of the instance
member.returns: new instance with only the references copied

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.InitializationErrors
member.summary: If an exception is catched during the initialization, it can be found here

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.PropertyTypes
member.summary: Get type of a property

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.Properties
member.summary: Get the raw property values of the property object Can be used to modify the directly, or for load/save Assignment to this will copy all the supplied properties.

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.InterceptedType
member.summary: The type which is intercepted

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Get the value for a property. Note: This needs to be virtual otherwise the interface isn't implemented
member.param: string with key for the property to get
member.returns: object or null if not available

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.PropertyNameFor(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve the real Property name, if you only have a key wh√≠ch isn't exact
member.param: Possible property name, like without capitals etc

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.RegisterMethod(System.String,System.Action{Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo})
member.summary: Register a method for the proxy

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.RegisterSetter(System.Int32,System.Action{Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.SetInfo})
member.summary: Register a setter, this will be called when the proxy's set is called.
member.param: int to specify when (in what order) the setter is called

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.RegisterGetter(System.Int32,System.Action{Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetInfo})
member.summary: Register a getter, this will be called when the proxy's get is called.
member.param: int to specify when (in what order) the getter is called

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Pretend the get on the property object was called This will invoke the normal get, going through all the registered getters

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.Set(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Pretend the set on the property object was called This will invoke the normal set, going through all the registered setters
member.param: Name of the property to set

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.Invoke(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: The method invocation

member.summary: A default implementation of the get logic

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.ExtensibleInterceptorImpl`1.DefaultSet(Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.SetInfo)
member.summary: A default implementation of the set logic

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetInfo
member.summary: This class contains all the information for the getter actions

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetInfo.HasValue
member.summary: The value of the property

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetInfo.Value
member.summary: The value of the property

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetSetInfo
member.summary: Information for a Get or Set invocation

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetSetInfo.Interceptor
member.summary: The interceptor that created this GetSetInfo

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetSetInfo.CanContinue
member.summary: Can the proxy continue with other getter/setters? This should be set to false if a getter/setter implementation wants to throw an exception or thinks there should be no more others.

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetSetInfo.Error
member.summary: This can be set to an exception if a getter/setter wants to throw an exception

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetSetInfo.HasError
member.summary: Simple property to check for error

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetSetInfo.PropertyName
member.summary: Property name of the property that is being get/set

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetSetInfo.PropertyType
member.summary: Type of the property that is being get/set

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.Getter
member.summary: Container class to store the getters, this allows them to be ordered.

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.GetterSetter
member.summary: Container class to store the setters, this allows them to be ordered.

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfoExtensions
member.summary: Extensions for the MethodCallInfo

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfoExtensions.PropertyNameOf(Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the property name from the argument "index" of the MethodCallInfo If the argument is a string, it will be returned. If the arugment is a LambdaExpression, the member name will be retrieved

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo
member.summary: This container holds all the information that is needed for extending the proxy with a method call It contains the arguments, return value and out arguments for an invoke.

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo.Interceptor
member.summary: The interceptor that created this MethodCallInfo

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo.Arguments
member.summary: the supplied arguments for the invoke

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo.Error
member.summary: Exception which will be passed to the invoking code

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo.HasError
member.summary: Simple check for the exception

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo.MethodName
member.summary: Name of the invoked method

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo.OutArgsCount
member.summary: get the Out-Arguments-count The ReturnMessage expects the outArgs/outArgsCount to have the return value in there too, this is why the get honors this. See: https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/752487/realproxy-invoke-method-throws-an-overflowexception-when-calling-endinvoke

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo.OutArguments
member.summary: get/set the Out-Arguments The ReturnMessage expects the outArgs/outArgsCount to have the return value in there too, this is why the get honors this. See: https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/752487/realproxy-invoke-method-throws-an-overflowexception-when-calling-endinvoke

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.MethodCallInfo.ReturnValue
member.summary: Return value for the invoke

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.SetInfo
member.summary: This class contains all the information for the setter actions

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.SetInfo.HasOldValue
member.summary: Does property have an old value?

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.SetInfo.NewValue
member.summary: The new value for the property

member.name: P:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.SetInfo.OldValue
member.summary: The old value of the property, if any (see HasOldValue)

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.Implementation.Setter
member.summary: Container class to store the setters, this allows them to be ordered.

member.name: T:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.InterceptorFactory
member.summary: This class is a factory which can create an implementation for an interface. It can "new" the implementation, add intercepting code and extensions.

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.InterceptorFactory.#cctor
member.summary: Register the known extensions

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.InterceptorFactory.DefineBaseTypeForInterface(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: This should be used to define the base type for the implementation of the interface

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.InterceptorFactory.DefineDefaultInterfaces(System.Type,System.Type[])
member.summary: This should be used to difine which default interfaces are added to the interfaces e.g. the IIniSection gets IDefaultValue and IHasChanges

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.InterceptorFactory.DefineImplementationTypeForInterface(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: If there is an implementation for the interface available, register it here.

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.InterceptorFactory.New``1
member.summary: Create an implementation, or reuse an existing, for an interface. Create an instance, add intercepting code, which implements a range of interfaces

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.InterceptorFactory.New(System.Type)
member.summary: Create an implementation, or reuse an existing, for an interface. Create an instance, add intercepting code, which implements a range of interfaces

member.name: M:Dapplo.InterfaceImpl.InterceptorFactory.RegisterExtension(System.Type)
member.summary: Use this to register an Type for extension
